other_tests.findings: Histology showed invasive papillary thyroid cancer over 2 cm in diameter and bilateral lymph node metastases (pathological stage T4N1bM0).
Post-therapy scan showed intense ¹³¹I uptake in the lungs; serum concentration of the thyroid-specific tumor marker thyroglobulin was 3750 ng/mL.
other_tests.changes_over_time: ¹³¹I uptake in lung metastases finally disappeared after repeated RIT. At the last follow-up in September 2019, thyroglobulin concentration had decreased to 17 ng/mL, classified as a stable partial response.
In 1996, no uptake was seen in the post-therapeutic scan.
